intro: Chaetanthus leptocarpoides, commonly known as the slender-fruited chaetanthus, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the family Apiaceae, which includes parsley and carrots, and is characterized by its delicate, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, clustered white or greenish flowers that bloom in late spring. Its fruit is a small, dry schizocarp, which splits into two one-seeded parts when mature. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories.
